Award.AbstractNarration:
The conference "Non-Archimedean Geometry and its Applications" will be held at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, during the period June 1-5, 2015. It will feature talks by world experts, encourage new collaborations, and serve as an excellent opportunity for junior participants to learn and meet experts in the mathematical field of non-Archimedean geometry. The senior speakers have been chosen on the basis of their research credentials, but also for being superior expositors with a dedication to the development of younger generations of researchers and teachers in mathematics. There will also be several junior speakers, and an opportunity for Ph.D. students and postdocs to present their work in a poster session. A strong effort will be made to have a diverse group of speakers and participants.

There have been numerous recent advances in non-Archimedean geometry, and these techniques have also seen new and sometimes unexpected applications. In order to make these developments known to a larger mathematical audience, the conference "Non-Archimedean Geometry and its Applications" will be held during the period June 1-5, 2015 at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. It will bring together leading experts in various fields where non-Archimedean geometry or analysis play an important role, and establish connections between these fields. Among the themes represented at the conference will be Berkovich spaces, tropical geometry, dynamical systems, and p-adic Hodge theory.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Intellectual merit:

There have been numerous recent advances in non-Archimedean geometry, and these techniques have also seen new and sometimes unexpected applications. In order to make these developments known to a larger mathematical audience, the conference ``Non-Archimedean Geometry and its Applications'' was held during the period June 1--5, 2015 at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. It brought together leading experts in various fields wherenon-Archimedean geometry or analysis play an important role,and establish connections between these fields. Among the themes represented at the conference were Berkovich spaces, tropical geometry, dynamical systems, and p-adic Hodge theory. More details about the conference, is available at the conference website: https://sites.google.com/site/nonarchconference/

 

Broader impact:

Non-Archimedean spaces first appeared in the context of number theory, in order to understand the complexity of numbers.Their name being a reference to Archimedes of Syracuse,they have features that are surprising to the usual geometric intuition.However, with the correct viewpoint,certain non-Archimedean spaces, such as Berkovich spaces, can in fact be understood in much the same way as the geometry that we see around us.

The conference that we organized focused on recent developments in the field of non-Archimedean geometry. The senior speakers were chosen on the basis of their research credentials, but also for being superior expositors with a dedication to the development of younger generations of researchers and teachers in mathematics. Overall, the conference was a great success.
